dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 8061 IH: Eliminating Limits to Justice for Child Sex Abuse Victims Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Ross (for herself, Mr. Swalwell, Mr. Reschenthaler, and Ms. Salazar) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to eliminate the statute of limitations for the filing of a civil claim for any person who, while a minor, was a victim of a violation of section 1589, 1590, 1591, 2241(c), 2242, 2243, 2251, 2251A, 2252, 2252A, 2260, 2421, 2422, or 2423 of such title.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Eliminating Limits to Justice for Child Sex Abuse Victims Act of 2022.

section.header: Elimination of the statute of limitations
section.text: Section 2255 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: There shall be no time limit for the filing of a complaint commencing an action under this section.

section.text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall—

paragraph.text: take effect on the date of enactment of this Act; and

subparagraph.text: any claim or action that, as of the date described in paragraph (1), would not have been barred under section 2255(b) of title 18, United States Code, as it read on the day before the date of enactment of this Act; and
any claim or action arising after the date of enactment of this Act.
